website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for casual hiking and trail running. Overall, a well-rounded boot at a nice price.
pros: Vibram soles are comfortable and supportive
cons: A large toebox leaves some users scrambling to find an optimal size

website_summaries.verdict: The Ventilator is an incredibly sturdy hiking shoe that's tough from the sole to the upper.
pros: The Moab Ventilator features an extremely durable construction that's also quick-drying and breathable
They can pretty much handle whatever you throw at them
A great value since the shoe will last a while
cons: The extremely resistant construction is a bit heavy

customer_reviews.title: comfy as always, not durable anymore.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great however they only lasted my father about two months. He doesn't hike, he works as hvac mechanic in residential settings. He swore by wearing Nike running shoes but since I was sort of a merrell devotee I got him a pair of ventilators as an introduction to merrells line of shoes. No idea why this happened so quickly, my father is a 130 LB non hiker. These shoes shipped out quickly on July 26th, it is now early September and they are TOAST. Have not got a response from merrell customer service and don't really expect to as they really don't owe me anything. IMO quality isn't there anymore in 2016, something is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Battaglia

customer_reviews.title: nice hiking shoes, very comfortable, even though not very long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought three pairs of these shoes over time. They are very comfortable, provide good support, and yet feel flexible and not rigid. The only complaint is that they do not last long as the fabric lining inside tends to fail over time and one it tears they are no longer comfortable and need to be replaced. I still buy them again because these are most comfortable hiking shoes I came across.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K

customer_reviews.title: Horrible shoes and horrible service from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fall apart. Horrible shoes and horrible service from the manufacturer. We bought these for our son to wear to the Boy Scout National Jamboree. Got them in April, Jambo is in July, they fell apart on June 2. Don't buy them with the expectation that they will last or that Merrell will be quick with replacing if needed. No Name shoes from Walmart have lasted longer and been through more rigorous use with less wear.
customer_reviews.author: jdion

customer_reviews.title: Far far better shoe than the MOAB II
customer_reviews.text: Far far better shoe than the MOAB II. This model is just about indestructible. Sure do wish Merrell would stop messing about with a proven product. Talk about shooting your own toe off, they sure did it with the MOAB II. Why on earth a successful company like Merrell would change such an excellent product to such a poor product can only be to reduce the cost of manufacture. Typical millennial thinking. The solution is simple, keep the quality of the product and charge a bit more for it. One more time, KEEP THE MOAB I and bag the MOAB II.
customer_reviews.author: Hal J. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Was it because the soles Soles not compatible with my low arch feet?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this supposedly for trekking in Nepal, they felt light and soft but for some reason they gave me some ankle issues/pain after several days of use. I ended up getting mizuno trekking shoes instead the day before trekking which made the pain go away and lasted me the whole ten day trek to the Annapurnas! Was it because the soles are not compatible with my low arch feet?
customer_reviews.author: Lionel B.

customer_reviews.title: Good support. For the first couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: They're decent enough shoes at first glance. Good support. For the first couple of uses, they functioned well enough. Terrible insoles. After a month the foam inside one of the heels curled up and now causes a very uncomfortable spot. "Heel bunching" or whatever. They're now uncomfortable enough that I avoid them entirely. I even cut into the heel to try to fix it, but the foam is formed into a curve that prevents it. Perhaps a bunch of glue and some staples would work? Nah. I'll just avoid this company in the future. * I cut all of the padding out of the heel of both shoes, and they're actually now incredibly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: nagahide13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me but slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: I got the size wide and they were perfect. I am absolutely in love. I have really wide feel and after putting these on i could feel a difference right out of the box. Totally thrilled *Update*, i found that these shoes are not very slip resistant. I was wearing them and walking during a light rain and completely lost my footing. One dislocated knee later i can say that i have never slipped quite like that before and am a bit dissapointed in the lack of traction on the shoe given that it was my second time wearing them
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never Again! Long-time buyer
customer_reviews.text: I must have purchased over 10 pairs of these over time. They used to be great, now they are awful. In recent years the glue would not last and the rubber or soles would fall apart just from minor walking. The latest pair lasted <2 months before the glue on both sides failed. See pictures attached, you can tell the shoes were not worn very often -- really disappointing for such expensive shoes. I feel obligated to warn potential buyers before spending their hard earned money.
customer_reviews.author: 2good2btrue

customer_reviews.title: Good Ratings Posted On Amazon; Not Good For Me
customer_reviews.text: There were reasonably good ratings but I agree with some who said you'll need to buy an insole to enjoy some comfort with these shoes. After about 5 wearings, I did buy an insole and it didn't help to improve the comfort very much. I was expecting a lot more from Merrell considering the brand name and price . I'll keep looking and suggest that you keep looking too if you are considering this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: WSW

customer_reviews.title: I love Merrell, and have had a dozen pairs over ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell, and have had a dozen pairs over the years. This pair is broken in only 4 months. The toes guards on both shoes have cracked and ripped. This is the first time I have ever had that happen. It is like they were dry rotted out. Maybe they were in storage at the reseller for too long. Be careful. My other Merrell's have lasted 2 years minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad shoe, but definitely a bad insole.
customer_reviews.text: Folks here recommended a 10 (27 cm foot), and I ordered a 10.5, so I'd have extra room for thick socks. The 10.5 just fits with regular sweat socks. They felt comfortable (only worn around the house once so far), but - as others have mentioned - the insoles are a disgrace for a shoe with Merrell's reputation and price point. They'll have to be replaced with something better, so factor that in to your budget. Merrell can afford to provide better insoles - very disappointing. The wide toe box is a bit roomier, if you have a wide forefoot. Sole feels like it should provide good stability and grip. Will update review after putting them through their paces.
customer_reviews.author: RamJacCorp

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars updated
customer_reviews.text: For how much these cost, I would expect them to last a bit longer. It is November now and I bought these in april. The sole and insides have held up nicely, but the front of the shoe at the toes is splitting from the sole leaving a big gap for water and such to get in. Buying a full leather shoe next time. Update: It is only March and the whole front of the sole tread is coming off and the rubber at the front of the shoe covering the toes is cracked and split everywhere
customer_reviews.author: huntercunning

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Merrell person for years, their shoes always felt amazing right out of the box. These however are terrible, fit and feel nothing like they used to. I have heard Merrell moved to some other country and that's why they have gone downhill, I have no idea if this is true but whatever the reason, these are terrible, i returned them and would not rec. Also, I went to my local REI to try on a pair of Merrell's they have there, they were Moab 2's, and they felt exactly the same. Sad to see Merrell sucks now.
customer_reviews.author: Klip

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Pair of Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered the Merrell Moab line of shoes at Dicks Sporting Goods while searching for a good pair of walking shoes that went well with khaki shorts or pants. Since that time, they are the only shoes I wear now and have lasted me through long days of walking at Disney World and grueling hikes through the North Woods. Well worth the money and built to last
customer_reviews.author: G.G.

customer_reviews.title: Ventilated as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Merrell's Moab Ventilator hiking shoes are comfortable and rugged. The liner wears out long before the soles or other parts (because i always leave them tied a little loose, which is bad for inner linings). They breathe better than most other shoes. I wipe out a pair every 8-9 months from the inside out, so i buy 2 pair at a time. they fit my flat-foot orthotics with no trouble and i can adjust or omit a loop for a bunion or not. HARD TO FIND 14 EE (14 wide) so i take whatever color i can find. I'm sure Merrell will "update" their selection and stop making these. (marketing fools) But for now they are the best for me!
customer_reviews.author: Howard Juno

customer_reviews.title: Best everyday/light hiking shoe I've worn
customer_reviews.text: I have fat feet (EEE), and the wide version of this shoe has been my favorite hiking and everyday shoe for about eight years. I've bought multiple pairs over this time, and have been satisfied every time. The only negative I can think of is the top eyelets fray the laces over time, so I find myself replacing laces on this shoe more often than others. But overall, a wonderful shoe!
customer_reviews.author: DSW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: When I first recieved the shoes, they were very comfortable while hiking and just everyday walking. however after about a month i began to notice the foots were curling up. and then the comfort went away. The souls of the shoe are still in great shape however the insert where has crushed and it's like walking on straight concrete without a shoe. I was hoping they would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and consistent
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how many times I've bought this shoe now, 5 or 6 times at least. It is always a pleaser. Since other reviews complained about comfort level, but I'm not sure what they are talking about. This pair of shoes feels like each pair I previously purchased, a loving hug for my feet. One word of note, if you have wide feet, make sure you purchase the wide ones. The regular ones *will* be uncomfortable. Unsure if you are a wide or not? Order both pairs, and return the one you don't want (or just go to the shoe store and try them on).
customer_reviews.author: E. Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Happy hubby!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears a 14 wide shoe, and they don't grow on trees. He's very picky and if I buy a pair he doesn't like they hit the bottom of his closet, never to appear again. He won't take these shoes off. He loves them. He says they are supportive and supremely comfortable, he likes the way they look, and that he wouldn't mind a pair to keep in reserve. This was the first pair of Merrell shoes I've purchased for him and will be a go-to brand from now on. They aren't cheap but your feet are no place to cheap out--happy feet equals happy face.
customer_reviews.author: G. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Light-weight Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: I would consider myself a beginner hiker and these boots were excellent. I thought they would need to be broken in but I only wore them a handful of hours before my 16 mile hike and my feet were comfy all day. I did incrementally tighten the laces (especially before going downhill) to keep my feet from sliding as the shoes "loosened" up over time. I read people's reviews to size up a 1/2-size. I wear either 11 or 11-1/2 in other brands and bought the 11-1/2, and the boots felt just a hair too big. But with good socks, they were fine. Highly recommend these affordable, lightweight hiking boots!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: One Very Happy Customer.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Nike ACG trail shoes (which I have had many pairs of, but are no longer made) with these. Great grip, comfortable, very good ventilation (thus don't use in winter - not insulated), fairly light, fits exactly as expected (I have a normal size 11 foot) and looks sharp. I use them for light trail hikes and some outdoor sports (grass volleyball). Only complaint is that I wish it had a little more stability or support. My Nike's had a little deeper foot well and a tighter fitting elastic wrap inside that was amazing at supporting your foot. All in all, would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a very good all around outdoor sport/active sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mace

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good-looking, durable, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I now own about seven pairs of these shoes, in varous states of wear—from decrepit (several years old and great for yard work and knocking about)—to a brand new pair that my wife likes well enough to let me accompany her while wearing them. These shoes are fabulous. Comfortable, long wearing and good-looking. Great with jeans, khakis or shorts, you can walk all day in them and your feet feel fine. Wore them on a 12-day walking tour in Northern Europe last year and they were wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Barewalker 58

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe, can be difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hiking shoe, Merrill seems to make some of the best hiking shoes available. Clean design, breathable top so excess moisture can excape, needed to reduce the chance of mildew. Combination of leather and fabric. Difficult to clean properly due to the design, a problem if you walk through muddy or swampy areas frequently. Water resistant but not water proof, despite any claims you might have seen or heard. Used to buy Teva versions of this (which were excellent until about 2 years ago), then they started making shoddy products, and then stopped making hiking shoes altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Tonkinese Lover

customer_reviews.title: comfortable with solid arch support
customer_reviews.text: So the venting through the top near toes is instantly felt by me. Like air conditioning! However, as when anyone hikes/walks, you generate heat on the bottom of your feet. The shoes get a little heated on the bottom of my feet. The fit is is awesome. I have thin to medium feet and the fit can be easily be adjusted by snugging the laces to fit whatever thickness socks are worn. I often wear thin smatwool type socks in different thickness's. They are heavily padded around ankle area and fit comfortably from the 1st day. I didn't give 5 stars because I really can't tell if the shoes vent well on lower sides. Time will tell?
customer_reviews.author: fish24/7

customer_reviews.title: Massive Price Variation Depending on Amazon's Vendors
customer_reviews.text: Wacky all-over-the-map pricing. Merrell... Fix This! Had to return my Moab Ventilators size 11 as they was too big (note" Merrells DO run true to size... I am a 10.5). They were $55 on Prime. The ONLY size 10.5 shoe available is ONE color style from ONE non-Prime vendor for $99... nearly DOUBLE! Needless to say, I am not purchasing them. (Sorry Merrell... but if you get more shoes into Prime I will be a customer.)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order w/ Spare Shoelaces
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrower foot and toes on the small side. The toes problem I heard from some reviews. I didn't feel it. Maybe if you have bigger toes? I feel my steps are well grounded yet off the ground a an inch in these shoes. A little space for shallow puddles. I never wore my Ventilators in the rain. I guess I am chicken. Tretorn rubbers for that rainy day anyway. Oh, I had a shoe lace break early on. Maybe order some shoelaces with the shoes. Not a reason not to buy these comfortable hikers. Still a really good pair of walking about shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Something has changed
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Merrell Moab Ventilators for over 15 years. I loved these shoes. However something's changed in their production and this latest pair simply did not fit right. I found I could curl my toes inside the shoe because the gortex band across the front of the shoe is much narrower and lower when compared to my previous pair. This creates too much expandable space in the toe part of the shoe. Also, my foot slides around inside the shoe, even when wearing thick socks. And most egregious, my feet are very sore after wearing these shoes for a few hours. That's never happened with previous pairs I've owned. I'm returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Tone

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty picky, so this says a lot
customer_reviews.text: These are my "go to" shoes. The shoes I wear every day. I buy a new pair of these about once a year (when the string and/or tread start to wear out, I just get a new pair of the exact same shoe). I'm pretty picky, so this says a lot. One out of ~6 pairs got a small rip near the top shoestring eyelet, and the narrow grooves in the tread tend to trap tiny rocks (which then scratch my laminate flooring). [see photos] The shoestrings come untied easily, and you have to double-knot them. But aside from those things, no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice material. They feel warmer than I expected, but this is a plus for me. Sole is great. It feels sturdy and very good grip. I wear 10.5 but I bought 11 because I wanted room for thicker socks if necessary. It feels roomy at the toe box, but fits well overall with normal socks. With thick socks, the shoe feel good. I recommend going half a size bigger if you plan to wear thick socks. Something I like about the shoe is that if you need to jog with them, they are not too heavy for a hiking shoe, and it is comfortable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Weird sizing
customer_reviews.text: I normally won't buy shoes online and this goes to prove why I shouldn't. I bought the size 9W as I had other Merrell shoes in the same size and they fit great. Unfortunately, these didn't. They were way too big. So, I returned them thinking the 8.5W would be the perfect size. I got those and they were small to the point my toes were curled up to fit in them. I'm not sure if there was an error at the factory or if this is how they fit. Since the difference in size should only be 1/8 of an inch, it doesn't make sense.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of Merrell Phoenix hiking shoes and was hoping they would be close to as comfortable and well made. Wow! My new favorite hiking shoes (I wear them every day to work and will do some hiking in them this summer). Extremely comfortable, great support, fit great, and look great too!!! I have a new favorite pair of shoes and if they last the same time as my Merrell Phoenix (a little over a year wearing every day) I will be replacing them next May with another pair of Moabs !!! Great product !!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Have always purchased merrell shoes and have loved them. I am however
customer_reviews.text: Have always purchased merrell shoes and have loved them. I am however, very disappointed with the insoles. They are junk! Why not just put a great insole in the shoe and charge a bit more? It makes no sense to sell a good quality shoe with an inferior, uncomfortable insole. The shoe itself seems as good quality as it always has been but if you want comfort plan on purchases insoles for these. Other than that the color is great and I am happy with the shoes (except for the insole issue) Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MaisiB

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my Merrell Moab Rover shoes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Merrell Moab Rover shoes. I have two pair of Merrell Moab Rovers, one waterproof, one not. I thought, "let me get some non-waterproof ventilators and I'll have a version for summer." WRONG. The ventilators have a different heel cup. My Rovers are super comfortable walking or standing. I stand A LOT. While hiking and/or running in the ventilators might be great, standing in them isn't. The heel cup is very small and put pressure on my heels. After a few hours of wearing them, I was in pain. Had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: David J Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To shoes for Wedding Shoots
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic back pain and plantar fasciitis that flare up the most when I shoot weddings. All that moving around taxes my feet and legs, which causes my glutes to tighten up, which puts extra strain on my back. These shoes are super comfortable and help ward off the chronic pain more than any other pair of shoes I've owned, other than the Asics Gel Nimbus I wear to work out (which I avoid waring to work on account of them looking unprofessional).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be good, but quality has gone downhill. Falling apart less than a year later.
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3rd pair of Moab Ventilators. I have loved this shoe, but this version has different inner liner fabric that has fallen apart very quickly. I purchased in August, 2016 and less than a year later of only wearing them on the weekends they are completely destroyed in the heel area of the inside liner with foam and fabric falling out. Very disappointed with this version. Quality has gone way downhill. Not sure what to replace them with as these fit so well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: NEVER, EVER AGAIN. MERRELL IS NOT MERRELL ANYMORE. LOW QUALITY HIGH PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give zero stars. My wife and I have bought about 10 pairs of Merrell's. The last 2 were awful. They totally fell apart after 8 months. The sole separated from the upper part for over 5 inches. I only used these as my everyday shoes. I work with computers and don't walk much. I didn't use these for hiking. They are low quality junk with a high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: T Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Not the same rugged Merrell shoe I was expecting.  Quality has come down.
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to my prior Merrell Moab ventilator hiking shoes, this one is not has strong nor well built. It seems to be a water down version. Merrell has achieved a great brand from prior sales of quality footwear. Now, they are just cashing in on the NAME without the QUALITY. Just guessing, but the weight of the shoes are about HALF my old pair. I will get shoe GLUE and fix-up my old pair of Merrell. Mind you, I give my old pair, exactly the same title, but sold about 3 years ago, a FIVE STAR. This one, sorry, it has been cut down. The color and the feel are good. But, wow -- not the same rugged feel.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough to be called hiking shoes, this is style at the expense of substance
customer_reviews.text: These aren't really hiking shoes. The sole support isn't durable enough to qualify. Somewhere around 2010 this brand's logo started getting bigger, and the shoes flashier, and then the quality just cratered. After about six months of casual use (walking to work twice a week, maybe a mile round trip) the soles collapsed and my feet started hurting, especially the balls of my feet and the arches. I tried using expensive third-party insoles to get another few months out of them, to little avail. I don't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Lima

customer_reviews.title: Sole becomes unglued where it joins the uppers
customer_reviews.text: Used these at work (kitchen) for about 6 months. Never abused them or got them wet or covered in oil and the sole became unglued next to the upper after 4-5 months. Merrell, like most companies, started out with a great product and over the years the prices go up and the quality goes down. Only gave 2 stars because they were comfortable and useful until they came unglued. But there's enough disposable items in this world, it would be nice to have shoes in this price range last a bit longer. That's not an unreasonable expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great "day long" or "trip long" shoe. This shoe is all I was looking for and more, from day one.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe for me. Lite, comfortable from day one, cushy, good quality and very aerated and comfortable on hot days. Excellent choice for extended "travel lite" trips with only one pair of shoes. Also very comfortable for bicycling. Only gripe is with hiking on gravely trails, small gravels get easily trapped in the sole. But like it so much I purchased the waterproof version as well.
customer_reviews.author: Prudent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Merrell is the best
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable and the Merrell name says it all. I was lucky enough to find these for $80, so I bought two pairs. The back of the shoe is the perfect stiffness so that I can easily slip these on and off, but they don't come off if I don't want them too. I always have my hands full of stuff and ain't nobody got time to tie shoes. I've tried to go to other lesser known brands and even at the same price they don't hold a match to any Merrells that I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Travis (Amazon customer since 2006)

customer_reviews.title: Moab Ventilator HIking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I got these on Wednesday and went to the Air Show at Oshkosh on Friday and was there for about 6 hours. Saturday I was there for 12.5 hours in these shoes and they are marvelous! Most of the time you are walking on the tarmac which is pretty warm and then the infield grass these shoes absolutely shocked me with how well they did. I did not intend to wear them this much I was planning on a test run and break in period and had my old pair of walkers in the car but never needed them. Great support cool and comfortable great great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Carey M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Own 3 pair
customer_reviews.text: First, I have a rare genetic skin disorder called epidemolysis bullosa simplex (EB for short). People with EB lack the protein the microscopic anchors that connect the layers of skin, resulting in blisters with excessive mechanical friction. With that being said I am still very active. These shoes have. Been nothing short of a life saver for me. They are very well ventilated and the wide toe accommodates my foot perfectly, which is important for me to say the least. I have worn these shoes every day for almost 2 years. I own 3 pair and alternate them regularly to allow them to dry out. I could not recommend them more. They are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The width felt TIGHT when I got them...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in "M width" and found them to be TIGHT (and I don't wear wide sizes). I couldn't wear them for more than 2-3 hours before my feet hurt. Over time they conformed better to my feet, but it took a few months. I wouldn't want to go through that break in period again, so I'm hesitant to order another pair when these wear out. The soles show no signs of wear after more than 2 years, so I think they will last longer than the Keens I had before these. Once I got them full of mud and washed them off, they SHRUNK from front to back. If I buy Merrells again I'm going 1/2 size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: BEST Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My second pair. Merrell has had this same design for several years. There's a reason, these are top notch hiking shoes. I still have the first pair...going on 5 years. I will wear them until they fall off. The design is excellent and they are comfortable as daily wear as well. I can go from street to a serious rocky hike in seconds. The only drawback IMO ,are the laces. They are a little short and tend to come untied easily. I purchased some a few inches longer and double tie them.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around shoe on the market (IMHO)!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this model since it was introduced around 18 years ago. Work, play, hiking, jogging etc. I never wear anything else, other than my Sorel pac boots for really bad outdoor conditions. I buy 2-3 pairs at a time. Each pair lasts around 18-24 months with VERY heavy, everyday use. Highest recommendation for these shoes. As long as Merrill keeps making them, they're the only multi-use shoes I'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: jpooch00

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and a good solid fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Merrell hiking shoes and I must admit I really like the brand. These shoes are very lightweight for a hiking shoe, and true to the name, they are ventilated. I have another pair that is waterproof (no ventilation) and there is a HUGE difference. After a day of wearing the waterproof shoes, I can't wait to get my shoes off so they can breathe. However, this pair is so well ventilated that they can be worn for a good long time without being too sweaty or hot. I've been wearing them for 6 months now and I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron W

customer_reviews.title: Exellent fit for wider feet
customer_reviews.text: After 4 Months use and walking 600 miles in My Merrells, I couldn't be happier with my choice to buy these shoes. After a few days break-in they feel so comfortable that the foot soreness I experienced with other shoes is completely gone. They wear like Iron - the tread is barely worn down. I'll write again when the are finally worn out; but I don't think it will be for awhile ..................................... I have wide feet and these exercise shoes fit the ticket. Most are too narrow, so I had to search for a wider width and glad I came across these Merrells. I love the fit and comfort; I can use them all day long.
customer_reviews.author: GCI King

customer_reviews.title: My "Go To" Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my sixth pair in as many years. This a great shoe for the money and I buy a new pair every year as I use the older pair as my "yard work" shoe and the new pair as my "walking around" shoe. My wife calls me a pain in the neck because I won't try anything new. I say if it works, why change? Merrell has been making these shoes for years and they have not changed the design because it works. Ready to wear right out of the box. I walked eight miles in downtown L.A. in these shoes the day after they arrived and my feet where fine.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle G

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Husband talking here... I love these shoes. Fit like a glove. I would even sleep in them. I have a normal foot so any of those issues don't apply to me. My wife has wide/bazaar feet so I understand those issues. My feet do not get hot so they do "ventilate" well. I have a pair of Merrell Pulsates that cook my feet when indoors. They are very light with excellent traction. I hike with my dog regularly and these perform perfectly. Extremely happy with them. Durability will need to be watched but I have had Merrell's before and I expect them to wear well or better. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Alley Knowes

customer_reviews.title: Close second to Geomorh Maze Stretch
customer_reviews.text: My favorite Merrells to date are the Merrell Geomorph Maze Stretch, but I can't find them anymore. So far, these are a close second in comfort. There is a shoe similar to the Geomorph Maze (Chameleon Prime Stretch), but it doesn't feel the same at all, and though it is similar to my favorite, it's a 3-star shoe in my opinion. The Ventilators are good for a narrow to normal foot and have good arch support, and wrap around your foot perfectly. I replaced the laces with Lock Laces and they're fantastic to hit the trails on.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Walker

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the Quality, Fit, and Comfort.  Very happy with them.  Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Merrell shoes and I cannot say enough good things about the fit, quality, and comfort of them. In the past, I've stayed away from this brand due to the cost (I thought it had the "Nike" type of mark-up and wouldn't be worth the cost), however, I'm glad I made the decision to purchase them anyway. They are very comfortable for all-day use. They fit dead-on according to the listed size. And, they are very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't walked in these a lot yet but so far they seem to be very comfortable when used with medium weight socks. I have a personal preference of a slight cushion under the ball of my foot and don't feel it with these. With medium weight socks however, they are OK. I normally take a size 12 in shoes of this type and these were no exception. The drop from five stars is actually like splitting hairs and due from my preference for slightly more softness in the sole.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: USED to Love Merrells, BUT . . .
customer_reviews.text: I have always LOVED Merrells . . . but the latest generation inside material does not last. Good fit, excellent support.After 8 months of occasional wear and light use the sole separated from the upper. I don't know if this is a sign of things to come with Merrell . . . in the past, there was no better option. But I may start taking a look at options after the last two pair. They used to last years, now they last a few MONTHS. COME ON Merrel - WHAT'S UP?
customer_reviews.author: James A. Dumas

customer_reviews.title: While I like these shoes and have just replaced the first 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: While I like these shoes and have just replaced the first 2 pair with another 2 pair, I find that for the trail it works best to put Dr Scholls insoles under the Merrell insoles. that cushions well against small rocks on the trail and provides a very comfortable experience. that is not to say the the Moab's without the Dr Scholls are not comfortable -- they are. It is just that on rocks terrain I need more under m foot and this combination is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: An engineer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes if you don't like hot feet
customer_reviews.text: Good airflow.. I always get one size larger to give more room for my toes. I've been buying these Merrell Moab Ventilator's for years and my feet are never hot or uncomfortable. Lace them a little loose for more airflow, they still stay secure while walking. My feet are wide so the medium doesn't flow as much air. The wide is the best. Medium are still good though. Funny that I wear them year around and my feet don't get cold in winter. I think it's due to blood flow not being restricted from shoes that are tight.
customer_reviews.author: don h

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Comfort for a Merrell shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Merrell shoes for years and this is the first pair, and unfortunately one of the most expensive, of shoes from them that I've been truly disappointed with. I work in the restaurant business and am on my feet for up to 14 hours a day. Since I tried my first pair of Merrell's six years ago I've sworn by them for their fit and comfort. Unfortunately the Moabs just don't seem to offer the same level of cushion and arch support as other other shoes from Merrell. I've worn these shoes for about 22 hours over the last 3 days and am convinced that I'm just going to have to get a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Boots on the Trail
customer_reviews.text: These are the best low-rise hiking boots I've found -- they're shoes, more accurately. Bought a half-size larger than my running shoes, and they're perfect. Bought an earlier pair of the size recommended by the advisor at a well-known outdoor gear store. But toes rubbed up against the toe-box so much on downhill hikes with pack, that I lost a nail. So I went up a half-size and these are just right. I also bought a pair of Montrail Enduro-Sole Trail Running Inserts and with the support of the Moab, I can go four or five hours without a break. Very nicely built and also attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Shrink Rap

customer_reviews.title: ... fashion industry always changing styles this really effect people like me. So I have order in bulk when ...
customer_reviews.text: I have feet problems so it is hard to find shoes that fit me correctly with the fashion industry always changing styles this really effect people like me. So I have order in bulk when I can shoes that fit me. To Merrell please keep the Moab line of shoes size 10 for a long long time. you will continue to get my business. I could careless about the latest style of shoes, it about form fit and function. It your shoes that allow me to walk so please don't quite make them. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: I love this style of Merrell shoe but the picture is very misleading.  This is the actual color..
customer_reviews.text: I love this style of Merrell shoe however the picture is totally misleading. They shoe is not blue at, it is actually a dark gray and nothing like the color in the picture, I thought I was paying any extra $20 plus because blue was a popular color and also is my favorite. These are the only type of shoe I wear and since I was wearing my current pair ripped, I don't know if they will hold up long enough to return these. I am very disappointed and irritated that I paid the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Update. I contacted corporate and Barb was very helpful. She apologized for customer service not getting back with me, wants me to send my shoes back so they can resolve the faulty issue, plans to correct the customer service issue, and plans to replace my shoes. I feel much better now about Merrell. Inside big toe area cracked on both shoes just after the 1 year warranty passed. I've emailed Merrell twice about this and no one has responded. I thought they valued their name and would stand behind their products. I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Wolterman

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as past purchases.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same shoe as in the past. Have worn these for years. Inside heel already worn out. Plenty of tread left. Expected these to last longer. Need to find some other comparable hiking/walking shoe. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Earl W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe BUT.......
customer_reviews.text: Look great, fit great and just an all around great shoe IF you want to buy a pair every year! They just don't last. The first thing that went was the material in the heel cup, the area near your Achilles. It wore through after about 9 months and that was the end for me. The spot that wore through rubbed until it hurt and I had to pitch them. The next thing that went was the lace loop. It just ripped and then they're useless. I need to find something sturdier with a leather heel cup.
customer_reviews.author: DXTAC

customer_reviews.title: Worst shoes I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the worst shoes I've ever purchased. Had no arch support at all, and after my fifth hike with these decided to toss them. Left my feet hurting for the following days. I go hiking nearly every weekend and I genuinely felt that hiking in flip flops would have been better than my experience with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Great for Trail Running
customer_reviews.text: I've had my first pair for nearly a year. I do a lot of trail running/hiking in dirt, rocks and hills. These shoes have proven excellent for these conditions. They are heavier than a running shoe, but much more stable, with good grip. The soles seem to never wear out - very impressive. The uppers don't wear much either, but the padding inside around the heel is starting to tear apart. This is after a year of heavy use, and around 500 trail miles in Yosemite, Desolation Wilderness and Grand Canyon. I love them so much I just ordered my second pair. Highly recommend for rocky trails.
customer_reviews.author: J. James

customer_reviews.title: Not good to go.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what's going on over at Merrell, but it seems like they are starting to lack quality control big time. I just got this shoe today and it's a horrible fit. It is too big and the design has several flaws. I've been ordering this shoe for the past 3 years and it's always a great shoe but something is wrong with this one. Gonna go to REI and try out some others.

customer_reviews.title: These Are My Second Style In Merrel Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Darn nice shoes! Comfortable right out of the box. Great looking. I'm an old codger now and even if your not one now as you age your feet do change shape usually getting wider and flatter. I've got older shoes and boots from 81/2 D and just about everything in between that including different widths and now these in 10D. All of them still fit fine. Some a little better than others. My suggestion in deciding what size to purchase is maybe buy them a little larger than you would a normal dress shoe especially if you plan on wearing them with anything thicker than a fairly thin sock or barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Horwitz

customer_reviews.title: For me, the best combination of comfort, durability, design, and price
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Merrell Moab's for at least 20 years. In that time I've gone thru 8 pair. They are very durable, but I wear them pretty much all day, every day so, eventually, they wear to the point where they need replacing. Thank goodness this model has stayed in production. This is good shoe for day hiking on groomed trails, but the sole is too light for use as a hiking shoe for walking cross country or on primitive trails. I have gone thru Adidas, Nike's, and Reebock's in this class of shoe and the Moabs are the winner, at least for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Shoe. A bit on the warm side...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe for days when I know my feet will be getting dirty and or on rough terrain. 13 wide is what I wear in new balance tennis shoe and Lowa Ranger boots. The fit did not disappoint. I haven't taken them on any serious hikes yet so I cannot attest to durability. These shoes are hot for me, hence the 4 stars. They have an extremely soft inside that almost feels like a blanket. It is good for comfort but gets hot quickly. Overall I am pleased and would recommend them for a general purpose outdoor shoe. If hiking in summer with these you better be wearing shorts tho!
customer_reviews.author: Scotty LMT

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my shoes
customer_reviews.text: Took these Merrell Moab Ventilator shoes on vacation without much break in, and could walk around in them all day without blisters or discomfort. I already have the hiking boot waterproof version of these, so I had high expectations from this version as well, and they did not disappoint. I liked that they're breathable and lightweight. They also provide decent traction on unpaved surfaces and decent arch support. My only disappointment is that I did not buy these shoes sooner.
customer_reviews.author: PreparedZombie

customer_reviews.title: After two years of abuse they started showing wear
customer_reviews.text: Whatever arch support this provides is pretty standard. I had to substitute an orthotic for each, but that's nothing new. I got the last pair I had of these for hiking - because of the Vibram sole. The sole has a lifetime guarantee, although I wouldn't know how long it really lasts. I started wearing them to work because they were so comfortable and after two or three years of wearing them all day every day the rest of the shoe started to fray, alas. Two years or more isn't bad, though.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot S! Maggin

customer_reviews.title: Kind of wide
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn these around the yard for a couple days, and the one thing that I might change is that they're a little wide at the ball of my foot. Normally, I just wear a size 8' medium width. These Merrell's are also listed as size 8 medium. The extra width makes for a slightly looser fit at the heel also, but so far, nothing I can't deal with. I'll be putting them to the test next week, and will review again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Good while they lasted...which was less than 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Worst shoes ever. Didn't last a year. -------- Original review: The shoes fit great and are very comfortable. I have no doubt that they will be great for hiking. My only issue, and it's a minor issue, is that the color of the shoe I ordered (Carbon) looks nothing like the picture. Not a deal breaker for me as the shoe still looks fine, just something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: CeeTee

customer_reviews.title: They fit a bit small but they seem to be great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I usually have pretty good luck ordering men's shoes online. My foot is evidently a standard men's foot- shoes almost always fit as I expected them to fit. These didn't. I ordered my standard size 11 and tried them on with socks- way too short. Without socks, they were still too short. I ordered 11.5 and they fit wonderfully and they feel great. I just received the right fitting shoes today so I cannot review their durability or function in various terrain and weather. But they feel great, very supportive, and I like the way they look.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Heegel

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes for the intended purpose of hiking
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for the intended purpose of hiking. Walking on pavement you are gonna have a rough time unless your feet are cast out of stone, they are just not designed to cushion on a hard unyielding surface without putting in a better insole. That being said they work quite well hiking, keep your feet cooler than a leather boot, and dry out quickly when wet. I have noticed that they dont have the best grip on slippery wet rocks or ice, the Vibram compound in these soles seems to be more towards durability than stickiness.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The Best All Around Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these shoes I have purchased. Really my husband wears them EVERYDAY for everything and loves them. So, after a year he asked me to get the same pair because they worked so well. Walking, gardening and around the house he finds them comfortable and supportive. Will keep buying them if they keep making them.
customer_reviews.author: Lori A Myers

customer_reviews.title: True classic
customer_reviews.text: The Moab ventilator is a classic. I have been buying a new pair more or less every year, and wearing them out by walking or running literally hundreds of miles with them. I will keep buying them as long as they make them. Probably my easiest buying decision all year long (the only though part is remembering that for the Moabs I need US size 9.5, rather than 9, to fit my Euro 43).
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Yves HERVE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My former review was 5 stars, but after wearing them not even 2 months, they have rubbed calouses on my feet and hurt to wear. I have always stood by Merrell, and I bought these because were men's and wide, so they wouldn't do this. I am a nurse and am on my feet 9-11 hours a day (I work over sometimes in Urgent Care), and this pair has really disappointed me. I am adding to this, I have contacted Merrell and they have offered to replace the item for free. 3/2016- Merrell sent me a replacement shoe at no cost, and they wear much better.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe ever made
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoe ever made. My wife and I both have been wearing these for years and have bought several "in reserve" pairs to wear over the years on our hikes just in case Merrell ever quits making them or changes them. Hopefully they'll continue to carry this gem as-is, because as Coca Cola found out when they tried the "new" formula years ago which flopped, if it ain't broke, don't fix it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Get your hike on with these.
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of work shoes. I've worn them every day at work for several months, walking between 10 and 12 miles per day, and my feet feel fine at the end of the day. No issues with stitching, soles or insoles. Also comfortable at the mall or out on a trail. Actually, they are more comfortable than my LL Bean Goretex hiking boots for which I paid 3 times the amount.
customer_reviews.author: Recondo82

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em.
customer_reviews.text: Love 'em. Sixth pair of Merrells I own. This pair is a great light-weight hiking shoe. Good for urban hiking, also simpler trails. (For more challenging wilderness, I recommend a half-height shoe, but that's just me.) Lightweight, solid platform, great arch, comfortable everywhere. Vibram sole is so great: wide enough to provide stability without being "running-shoe" wide under the heel. I'm sold on Merrells.
customer_reviews.author: ThomF

customer_reviews.title: Bought for hiking.  Became my day to day shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I do a mix of urban and trail hiking and I wanted a shoe that meets both those needs. Not only have they been excellent in that regard they've become my day to day shoe. I upgraded the laces to LOCK LACES (Elastic No Tie Shoelaces) and they're hands down the best shoe I've ever owned. Comfortable. Warm on cool days. Cool on hot days. When these wear out I'm just going to buy another pair. I'm very happy with the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: s1ugg0

customer_reviews.title: They provide excellent traction.
customer_reviews.text: As others have written, these run somewhat small - especially in width; I have "always" worn dress shoe size 13AA; I purchased size 14 medium in these Moabs, and with a bit heavier sock, they fit well. I have only had them about a month, so my comments about quality need to be taken in that light; they look very well constructed to me, I have had no quality issues with them, and anticipate I will get lots of miles out of them. They provide excellent traction. UPDATE 10/4/16: I am now on my third pair of Moabs (I wear them every day). Quite simply, I have found them to be fantastic! Excellent quality, extremely comfortable, and great traction!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Amberger

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Good fit. Prompt delivery. This is my second pair of this specific Merrell shoe. They are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn, beautifully made, and I think very good looking. I literally wear them almost every day, for lots of different kinds of challenging activities. The first pair lasted 3 years before one of the soles began separating from the shoe - but that one is still wearable. My one criticism is that the laces are 3"-4" too short for comfortably being able to double-knot when tying. Round shoe laces like these need to be double-knotted in order to not repeatedly untie by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: P. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last as long as they should have!  But Merrell backed their product!
customer_reviews.text: Update 9/15/2016 - Got these shoes at the end of March this year. The inside seam has already split about 4 inches. Waiting to see if Merrell backs their up their products. I wear these shoes at the office and for light hiking and there is zero reason they should have worn out this soon. Update 10/4/2016 - Merrell not only backed their product but I received a new pair of shoes from them in the mail today. Awesome to have a company back their product like this! Would definitely buy from Merrill again!
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable and Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great all-around shoes. VERY durable. I wear these hard as everyday shoes at work. They stay nice looking for about a year. Then I get another pair and wear the old pair another year working in the yard. I've been on this cycle for about six years, so it's safe to say that I'm pretty satisfied with their quality and consistency. I tend to be on my feet a good part of the day on hard and/or rugged surfaces. Feet never ache. The sole inserts that come with these are ok but I have unusually high arches and use inserts in all my shoes. With that said, these shoes still have better arch support than most.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. Got a replacement for defective product
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Got a replacement for defective product. Now I'm battling trying to send back the defective product. Tried to send them back multiple times. Now I'm more than likely gonna have to pay twice. Once for the replacement and once for the pair that fell apart on the second time of wearing them..... NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Decent hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I just got my shoes last week and have only been out once with them but so far I really like them. I did an 8 mile hike with pack yesterday and was very happy. Good support and traction. Pretty light weight. As I wear them more I will update my review as needed. Right now I would have went with 5 stars but with one 8 mile hike in I would like to get more miles to see wear and tear and if the support breaks down. So far, so good!! Still going good after about 40 miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: WoodsWalker

customer_reviews.title: Just got the shoes today and they feel great, very happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Just got the shoes today and they feel great, very happy with them. The only reason that I am giving 4 stars is because I ordered the denim with a white background and I think they sent me the walnut. Not a big enough problem to return them since these still look pretty good. I generally wear a 9 1/2 to 10 but ordered a 10.5 and they fit absolutely perfect leaning a tiny bit on the snug side so I would advise upping your size by 1. They feel very quality but we shall see after a lot of walking in them.
customer_reviews.author: David Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: 99% of the time I switch between two pairs of shoes: these Merrel Moab Ventilators, and a pair of Merrel Moab leather ankle-high waterproof boots. They are incredibly comfortable and as the name suggests provide great ventilation for your feet if like mine yours tend to get a bit sweaty in hot months. If you need arch support you may want to get an insert. My last pair of Merrel Moab shoes lasted me 5 years and I still have them around the house somewhere. I expect these to last me just as long, and when they eventually need replacing, I'll probably buy another pair again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable, but NOT durable
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit well. My only complaint is that I purchased these for our trip to Italy where I knew that I would be walking a lot. I wanted to have a bit more support and the ability to take some hikes around Cinque Terre. About a week into the trip I noticed that the top of the shoe started to fray. I am really disappointed because I have had great luck with Merrell shoes before. Unfortunately, I purchased these a bit before the trip so it was outside of the return window for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time finding shoes that fit: Wide (EE) forefoot, high instep, narrow heel (think old New Balance SL2 last). These Merrells meet my needs perfectly! As with all my hiking boots, I immediately remove the insoles, and replace with Spenco insoles. Moab Ventilators provide comfort, support and TRACTION on all of my warm, dry weather hikes. The only drawback to these shoes is that the traction soles will wear quickly when worn on concrete. Therefore, I recommend you wear them only off the pavement. I just received my third pair, and am hopeful that this model will continue to be offered by Merrell. I highly recommend these hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mendo

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product- Multiple Purchases
customer_reviews.text: I've had three other pairs of the hiking boot version, I wore them out during overseas trips to hot places. Much more breathable than any other boot I've tried. I'm out of that line of work now and thought I'd try the lower cut version. I must say I prefer the hiking boot style. Not to say this is an uncomfortable shoe, it's still great Merrell quality & fit, just not my preferred style.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith 9829

customer_reviews.title: From Backpacking to Working 14 hrs a day on my feet
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Light weight - Maintains a stiff or solid arch (its base is NOT flimsy / bendable) - Very breathable mesh throughout which keeps feet cool in warm conditions (note, this mesh will be the first thing to fall apart on you. It will un-stitch/ un-thread itself in do time) - Good traction - Comfortable. I took these all over south Asia and I'm wearing them now at work, where I walk up 21 flights of stairs 3x a day..Seriously.... Cons: - Expensive for basic shoe material - The shoe's souls aren't impressive (lightweight thin foam. I'd expect more from an expensive shoe, however it IS impressively lightweight). - They aren't built to last longer than the average shoe
customer_reviews.author: shoal

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and finally a shoe that isn't too narrow on standard widths
customer_reviews.text: I bought these like 2 years ago at a Dick's sporting goods and I decided to pop in a review b/c I'm buying the boot version of the Moab on amazon right now. I have worn them almost everyday for years and they are very comfortable and have no signs of damage from the use. I love the sizing on these too, they are a little roomier in terms of width and it was the main reason why I picked them up initially. Stop making tiny, narrow ballerina shoes for men (looking at you Adidas).
customer_reviews.author: Tom Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Best All Around Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I tried Merrell hiking shoes years ago as a tennis shoe and they are all I wear now. I was told when I first tried them that they were worn by our military. Whether or not that is true, it is believable. These shoes are comfortable, provide great support, and they are sturdy. I get many years of wear out of them. I have worn these for vacations where we have walked on city sidewalks all day. I have worn these for hiking in the Grand Canyon. They are comfortable for every day wear and they are sturdy enough for hiking. I highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CautiousBuyer

customer_reviews.title: A bit lower grade than the previous version, but still good
customer_reviews.text: My previous pair of this model shoe worked great for a couple of years until it fell apart, so I got the same kind again. For some reason it feels like the current insole version is a tad less padded, the internal materials in general seem a bit less sturdy, and there is a bit more width than I need around the ball of the foot. The difference is subtle but noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Linux Administrator

customer_reviews.title: Solid Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the shoes for a little bit but so far so good. The insoles that come with the shoes aren't very great but orthotic insoles solve that problem quick and easy. Seem to be very durable and comfortable. Haven't tested them in wet conditions yet. Primarily I use them for ruck training anywhere from 20-40 miles a week. I know a lot of other people had issues with blisters, but I haven't so far. I think proper insoles, wearing the right kind of socks, and tightening up the shoes properly should help prevent blisters. Could always wear mole skin too. Overall, definitely a solid choice especially for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: Good walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear size 9.5 - but was told to go up a little from previous reviewers so I got size 10. They seem to fit but the heel causes blisters because it's really narrow so I'm slowly breaking them in. The tread is amazing - perfect for the Southern California mountain desert environment. When the wind blows - I can feel the air on my feet, which is really nice (but may not be for those who want more water resistance). I'm happy with these shoes - they're going to take a little getting used to but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: P. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: they were comfortable from the first hours i had them as they ...
customer_reviews.text: ive been wearing these as my everyday shoe for about 3mo now, while they are not waterproof as some have said they have gotten me though my daily city, suburban, rural and festival journeys quite well, they were comfortable from the first hours i had them as they are now. no break time required as so many others have also stated. the one drawback i would say is that the soles dont seem to provide much grip, or as much grip on wet stone or pavement as i would like from a 'hikeing' shoe, but that could be my over expectations. TLDR: comfortable all day from day one, worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kenobi

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab Ventilator Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: Let feet breathe while attacking the trails in this low-top, multi-sport hiker.
feature_bullets: Hiking shoe with water-resistant leather and mesh upper featuring rubber toe bumper and heel counter
Air Cushion midsole and Vibram Multi-Sport TC5+ rubber outsole
